text: Namdalens Folkeblad (The Namdalen People's Gazette) was a Norwegian newspaper published in Namsos from 1899 to 1942 and from 1945 to 1963.Norske aviser 1763–1969: en bibliografi. 1973. Oslo: Universitetsbiblioteket i Oslo, p. 328. The newspaper was a continuation of the periodical Gjallarhorn. The newspaper presented itself from 1899 to 1926 as "a temperance, news, and advertising paper; an entertainment paper for the home."Wasberg, Gunnar Christie. 1969. Norsk presse i hundre år: 1820–1920: utsyn og overblikk. Oslo: Gyldendal, p. 156. The newspaper was taken over by Nordtrønderen og Namdalen in 1964.Store norske leksikon: Nordtrønderen og Namdalen. Editors of the paper included Ludvig Larssen,Diesen, Emil. 1921. Norske aviser og tidsskrifter med fortegnelse over norske pressefolk 1920. Kristiania, p. 46. Reidar Stavseth,Steenstrup, Bjørn (ed.). 1973. Stavseth, Reidar. Hvem er Hvem? Oslo: Aschehoug, pp. 525–526. and Haakon Storøy.Handels- und Industrie-Adressbuch Norwegens. 1966. Oslo: S.M. Bryde, p. 1810. ==References== Category:Defunct newspapers published in Norway Category:Norwegian-language newspapers Category:Mass media in Trøndelag Category:Namsos Category:Publications established in 1889 Category:Publications disestablished in 1963
title: Namdalens Folkeblad
